channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: FBI Deputy Director Dan Bongino says he will step down in January
item.description: Bongino's tenure was at times tumultuous, including a clash with Justice Department leadership over the Epstein files. But it also involved the arrest of a suspect in the Jan. 6 pipe bomber case.
item.content:encoded:
Bongino's tenure was at times tumultuous, including a clash with Justice Department leadership over the Epstein files. But it also involved the arrest of a suspect in the Jan. 6 pipe bomber case.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Federal court says troops can stay in D.C., and hints at prolonged deployment
item.description: A federal appeals court in Washington, D.C. has ruled that National Guard troops can remain in the city for now. That decision comes after a different federal appeals court ruled that troops must leave Los Angeles earlier this week.
item.content:encoded:
A federal appeals court in Washington, D.C. has ruled that National Guard troops can remain in the city for now. That decision comes after a different federal appeals court ruled that troops must leave Los Angeles earlier this week.

(Image credit: Heather Diehl)
item.dc:creator: Kat Lonsdorf

item.title: Jack Smith defends his prosecutions of Trump in closed-door session in Congress
item.description: The former Justice Department special counsel told the House Judiciary Committee that his team developed "proof beyond a reasonable doubt" that Trump took part in a criminal scheme to overturn the 2020 election.
item.content:encoded:
The former Justice Department special counsel told the House Judiciary Committee that his team developed "proof beyond a reasonable doubt" that Trump took part in a criminal scheme to overturn the 2020 election.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: A Chinese man who filmed secret footage in Xinjiang risks deportation from the U.S.
item.description: Guan Heng sailed to the U.S. by boat from the Bahamas after publishing footage he filmed of purported detention camps in China. He has been held in immigration detention since August.
item.content:encoded:
Guan Heng sailed to the U.S. by boat from the Bahamas after publishing footage he filmed of purported detention camps in China. He has been held in immigration detention since August.

(Image credit: Guan Heng)
item.dc:creator: Emily Feng

item.title: Watch now: Trump speaks to nation as economic concerns drag on his approval ratings
item.description: The president was expected to devote the year-end speech to his accomplishments so far in his second term and look ahead to next year.
item.content:encoded:
The president was expected to devote the year-end speech to his accomplishments so far in his second term and look ahead to next year.

(Image credit: Doug Mills



)
item.dc:creator: Danielle Kurtzleben

item.title: Italy makes a surprising discovery ahead of the Winter Olympics: dinosaur tracks
item.description: A nature photographer stumbled upon thousands of 210-million-year-old dinosaur tracks in Italy's central Alps, near where some Olympic skiing and snowboarding events will be held in February.
item.content:encoded: A nature photographer stumbled upon thousands of 210-million-year-old dinosaur tracks in Italy's central Alps, near where some Olympic skiing and snowboarding events will be held in February.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Senate passes $901 billion defense bill that pushes Hegseth for boat strike video
item.description: The Senate has given final passage to the annual National Defense Authorization Act, which raises troop pay by 3.8%. It also pressures Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to provide lawmakers with video of strikes on alleged drug boats near Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
The Senate has given final passage to the annual National Defense Authorization Act, which raises troop pay by 3.8%. It also pressures Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth to provide lawmakers with video of strikes on alleged drug boats near Venezuela.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Why I volunteered to be infected with dengue fever
item.description: The U.S. has registered over half a million clinical trials since 2000. Here's a look at the business and ethics of human medical experimentation through the eyes of a volunteer.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has registered over half a million clinical trials since 2000. Here's a look at the business and ethics of human medical experimentation through the eyes of a volunteer.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Max Barnhart

item.title: 'Vanity Fair' reporter gets an inside view from Susie Wiles, the woman behind Trump 2.0
item.description: Writer Chris Whipple interviewed Trump's chief of staff 11 times, getting her view on cabinet members, Trump's revenge tour, Venezuela policy, and why she says Trump has an "alcoholic's personality."
item.content:encoded: Writer Chris Whipple interviewed Trump's chief of staff 11 times, getting her view on cabinet members, Trump's revenge tour, Venezuela policy, and why she says Trump has an "alcoholic's personality."
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: More than 10% of Congress won't return to their seats after 2026
item.description: NPR is tracking the record number of congressional lawmakers — now more than 1 in 10 current members — who have announced plans to retire or run for a different office in 2026.
item.content:encoded:
NPR is tracking the record number of congressional lawmakers — now more than 1 in 10 current members — who have announced plans to retire or run for a different office in 2026.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler
